questions.question: Can I use the electronics of the FOB for a key that I already have cut or are they one molded piece?
answers: Yes, you can take the electronics out but they would have to be programmed to work with the vehicle. If it is not programmed correctly, the key will work in the door locks only. The remote will not lock or unlock the doors and the key will not start the vehicle. Hope this helps.

The electronics will work to open the door and you can move the electronics for that from one key to another.  However, there are apparently other electronics/settings associated with the key itself and you have to get it cut and programed to actually be able to also start the car with it.
Yes, the parts are interchangeable, but will need programmed to work with your vehicle.

questions.question: How do you remove the old mirror? Just grab and pull?
answers: Use a large screwdriver and some padding to protect and pry the broken mirror off.
If your lucky that  will work. Good videos on YouTube that will help
Yes, be careful

It will pop out with a prying effort with your hands(fingers) or a wood chisel or a flat blade screw driver. Just work around all the edges until it pulls free. Be careful of the electrical connections and how they are positioned with the old mirror so you will see how they connect on the new mirror. Also, be careful when seating the new mirror and do not apply force that will break it. The new mirror should seat with no problem.Be ready to catch any broken glass from the old mirror when it is pried out of the housing.Mine works like new.

Yes... gently, but firmly start on the outside edge... might start it with a screwdriver, but careful not to mess up the paint on the outside edge.  It feels like you might break it, at least I did, but it finally started coming off.  I gained courage to do this on my own, and with a bit more force, by watching this guy as well...  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KAVMytNt4hgGood luck, I hope this helps!
I used a screw driver and popped it off.  Then I removed the wires on back of mirror, reapplied to new mirror and popped mirror back in.

questions.question: Is the mounting kit included in the cost? Thanks in advance
answers: Yes its included.

Everything you need to mount it is included, but you may have to drill 2 holes in the frame for the supports. The holes are already there, but on some models they are too small for the bolts and just need to be made a bit larger. It also uses the bolts already on your truck for the tow hooks on each side, so make sure those are both still there and not rusted in place. I had to use an impact wrench to break them loose.

Yes, everything you need for mounting comes with it minus the tools needed for installation. There are two brackets that mount to the bottom of your frame rails, as well as two that stabilize and come through the lower part of your grille that mount through your frame rails. Overall, a very simple installation. Less than half an hour if you have a friend to help hold the brush guard in place as you bolt on
